physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Drowsy and confused, profound ataxia without dysmetria, right facial hemiparesis, erythematous indurated lesion at the site of a tick bite on his medial right thigh.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: 430 leukocytes (96% lymphocytes)/mm^3, protein level 133 mg/dL, glucose level 43 mg/dL.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Mild improvement in lymphocytic pleocytosis observed in subsequent lumbar punctures.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Inability to open eyes to stimulation or follow commands; left leg exhibited triple flexion to noxious stimulation.

MRI showed increased symmetric hyperintensities of the cortex and cerebellum with associated leptomeningeal enhancement, new involvement of the midbrain, and partial effacement of the fourth ventricle.
Minimal neurological recovery, discharged to an acute care facility.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Reported to be able to nod his head to questions and slightly move his upper extremities and toes seven months after discharge.
